Yesterday, @TheBlackCaucus commemorated the first-recorded forced arrival of enslaved African people to what would one day become the United States of America.

As a generation ages that didn’t witness this day 18 years ago, it’s increasingly important we honor the sacrifices made and the lives lost.

#NeverForget pic.twitter.com/FiUoon8woW

It's everywhere. pic.twitter.com/w65FY0nS6E

We must help these children. 5/5 https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/04/politics/family-separation-inspector-general-report/index.html …

"The most challenging thing is the lack of time due to the caseloads. Our concern is always whether the quality of therapy suffers... It becomes a strain on us." 

– a Lead Mental Health Clinician 4/

"Physical symptoms felt by the children are manifestations of their psychological pain.

You get a lot of ‘my chest hurts’ even though everything is fine.

Children describe symptoms, ‘every heartbeat hurts’ or ‘I can’t feel my heart’, of emotional pain.”

– a Medical Director 3/

“A 7- or 8-year-old boy was separated from his father, without any explanation...

The child was under the delusion that his father had been killed and believed that he would also be killed.

This child ultimately required emergency psychiatric care...” 

- a Program Director  2/
